speaker: PANELIST
line: Some feel that contact with other civilizations is no longer beyond our dream, but is a natural event in the history of mankind that will perhaps occur within the lifetime of many of us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: VOICE
line: Let her through.

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: Detective Rempulski, Alexandria P.D. Thanks for coming down to do this. It him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Scully, please have a seat. Agent Scully, we've had a brief discussion, that will you restate the matter we're here to put to rest?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes sir. Four years ago, Section Chief Blevins assigned me to a project you all know as the X Files. As I am a medical doctor with a background in hard science, my job was to provide an analytical prospective on the work of Special Agent Fox Mulder, who's investigations into the paranormal were fueled by a personal belief that his sister had been abducted by aliens when he was 12. I come here today, four years later, to report on the illegitimacy of Agent Mulder's work. That it is my scientific opinion that he became over the course of these years a victim. A victim of his own false hopes and of his beliefs in the biggest of lies.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: We're meeting the guide at base camp. He'll take us to the site.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: Has he seen it?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Oh, yeah. He said it's unbelievable. BASE CAMP

speaker: BABCOCK
line: How soon til we can get to the site?

speaker: MAN
line: Right now? We'd be pushing it to get to the camp by nightfall.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: I'd rather sleep seeing it than lay awake all night wondering.

speaker: MAN
line: It will take some work.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: I've waited all my life for this day.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: Let's do it. LATER LATER

speaker: MAN
line: We're here.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: My God, it's beautiful.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Scully, I presume you have a basis for this break from Agent Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes Sir. Recent events have shed new light on the factual and physical evidence that would serve to prove the existence of extra terrestrial life, which was the foundation of Agent Mulder's consuming devotion to his work.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: What factual evidence?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder was recently contacted by man who's pursuit of this evidence seemed to coincide with his own. In his intense desire to believe, Agent Mulder was duped by this man. He was fooled by an act of scientific slight of hand calculated to perpetuate false truths, a larger lie. I am here today to expose this lie. To show the mechanism of deception that drew him and me into it. And to expose Agent Mulder's work for what it is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So he toppled over me and down the stairs.

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Speaking of Bill, is he coming?

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: There he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at you, my big brother.

speaker: BILL
line: Sorry I'm late. My ship got stuck in traffic. You get my birthday card?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I did. Thanks for remembering this year.

speaker: BILL
line: Well, once a decade...

speaker: BILL
line: How are you feeling?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fine. Let's get some dinner, huh?

speaker: BILL
line: Yeah, starving. LATER

speaker: BILL
line: Mom, I'll open some more wine.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: FATHER
line: I feel awkward sitting here. I'm sure you do too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: FATHER
line: I've known your family so many years. Your mother asked me to come. That I might have a word with you. I know it's been some time since we've spoken ourselves, since you drifted from the church...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father McCue, I...

speaker: FATHER
line: But a time of personal crisis, a threat to your health, going back to your faith is important and essential.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Father McCue.. I appreciate my mother's concern, and yours. But I'm being treated for my cancer and taking every precaution.

speaker: FATHER
line: Faith can make you stronger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I haven't felt the need. I have strength and I... I'm not going to come running back now. It's just not who I am. I'd be lying to myself, and to you.

speaker: BILL
line: Dana... phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey Scully, it's me. Sorry to interrupt your dinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, is something the matter?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I need your help on something. I was just contacted by Doctor Arlinsky from over at the Smithsonian.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Contacted you about what?

speaker: MULDER
line: About something he found on a mountain in Canada.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd rather not talk about it the phone, I just need you to meet me over at the Smithsonian.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When?

speaker: MULDER
line: Right away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm on my way.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're going to have to apologize for me to your brother and mother. This is something that just couldn't wait though.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay. Who's this... Arlinsky?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's a forensic anthropathologist that I've been in contact with over the last four years. Several years ago he was involved in an embarrassing UFO photo enhancement scandal. But he continues to profess his innocence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What am I coming to see?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not going to tell you. I'm going to let you decide for yourself.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: By my rough estimate from the sediment in the ice core sample, the body you're looking at is over 200 years old.

speaker: MULDER
line: Perfectly intact.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: That doesn't make sense. There should be signs of gradation.

speaker: ARLINKSY
line: The position it was found in. Stuffed in a crevice at high altitude. He may have frozen fast enough to avoid being eaten.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does that fit geologically?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: The area where it was found, is in the terminal moraine of a glacier that has since receded. Over 200 years ago, where the alien was frozen was in the tree line so there might have been a thaw.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who found him?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: A Canadian geodetic survey team. Along with a colleague of mine, Babcock. They're all still up there on the mountain.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who all knows about this?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: I know what your first thought was. But the St. Elias range? It's an awful long way to go for a hoax.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you're going to go, why not go all the way?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: I circumspect myself. But the ice core samples that I took. They can't be faked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You have the ice core samples here?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Yeah. One taken from each side of the body. 360 degree matching the integrity of the sediment. It's my sincere belief that what we have here is the complete corpus of an extra terrestrial biological entity. Absolute and unrefutible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Qualitatively indefensible. You go public with this nobody is going to believe you. You also risk never knowing for sure because the same people who bury the truth so assiduously will be in charge of its authentication.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: That's why I came to you. I need to get the specimen out so I can authenticate it. This body means everything to you, Agent Mulder. You could have the proof in your hands.

speaker: MULDER
line: And what do you want?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: I just want the credit.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think it's foolish?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have no opinion, actually.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have no opinion?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is your holy grail, Mulder. Not mine.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It just means proving to the world the existence of alien life is not my last dying wish.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Santa Claus or the Easter Bunny? This is not some selfish pet project of mine, Scully. I'm as skeptical of that man as you are, but proof... definitive proof of sentient beings sharing the same time and existence with us, that would change everything. Every truth we live my would be shaken to the ground. There's no greater revelation imaginable, no greater scientific discovery.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You already believe, Mulder. What difference would it make? I mean, what would proof change for you?

speaker: MULDER
line: If someone could prove to you the existence of God, would it change you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Only if it were disproven.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you accept the possibility the belief in God is a lie?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think about it, actually, and I don't think it can be proven.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what if it could be? Wouldn't that knowledge be worth seeking? Or is it just easier to go on believing the lie?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't go with you, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you at least take a look at those core samples? Tell me if they're a lie? That's all I'm asking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I couldn't tell Agent Mulder, what I had only learned myself, was that the cancer which had been diagnosed in me several months earlier had metastasized. And the doctors told me, sort of a miracle, it would continue to aggressively invade my body, advancing faster each day toward the inevitable.

speaker: MAN
line: What's that for?

speaker: BABCOCK
line: I don't know these men well. Do you?

speaker: MAN
line: Well enough.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: I'm going to be up here alone until you get back. I hope I don't have to use it.

speaker: OTHER MAN
line: I think you'd better have a look at this.

speaker: OTHER MAN
line: We were doing a lateral cut in the back quarter when I saw something in the ice. Right here.

speaker: MAN
line: What do you think that is?

speaker: BABCOCK
line: I don't know. A bubble... a weak spot...

speaker: OTHER MAN
line: Or a casing channel. A pour hole. Liquid poured in from the side or above somehow.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: Poured from where?

speaker: OTHER MAN
line: I don't know.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: The angle wouldn't make sense.

speaker: OTHER MAN
line: Yeah, you're right.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: We'll never know until we get it out of there. LATER ON MOUNTAIN

speaker: LAB TECH
line: The iron concentration density and temperature profiles are all consistent. There's a tight matrix of crystals of approximable center. Suggesting the quick freezing scenario we mentioned. Here at the terminus, you've got some particular hydro carbons, jet fuel pollutants found just about everywhere in the world.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But not in old ice.

speaker: LAB TECH
line: Don't misunderstand. This is old ice. This sample has numerous levels of sedimentation like the rings on a tree essentially.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So it hasn't been tampered with?

speaker: LAB TECH
line: No, not that I can see here. Can I ask why you're having this ice sample tested?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Another agent asked me to.

speaker: LAB TECH
line: Do you know where this sample came from?

speaker: SCULLY
line: From a site in the Yukon Territory, why?

speaker: LAB TECH
line: Some cellular material within the matrix...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Plant or animal?

speaker: LAB TECH
line: I don't know. It's what I'd have to classify as a chimera. A hybrid cell.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From what?

speaker: LAB TECH
line: As I said, I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it capable of cell division?

speaker: LAB TECH
line: I don't know that either. I just now found them. I'd like to get them under our electron microscope. If that's okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Please.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought you said there was someone meeting us.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Yeah, a guide named Roston.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: I don't get it. This had all been arranged. I don't know what to do. LATER

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: We should be able to follow this track all the way up to the site. LATER

speaker: MULDER
line: Funny place to take a nap.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: God.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's been shot. He's our guide?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me, I'm looking for Dr. Vitagliano. Dr. Vitagliano, is he here?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: No, I'm afraid not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm supposed to meet him here. Actually, I a little late.

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Sorry.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Oh, my God! They're all dead! They've been shot.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Babcock! The body...! It's gone! They took it! No one knew. We didn't tell a soul.

speaker: MULDER
line: They had radio communication. Maybe it was being monitored. Someone's still alive.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: It's Babcock.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get him some water. Look's like he took a shotgun hit, but it didn't open him up too badly. The bleeding stopped.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Who did this? They took the body, Babcock.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: No. I buried it.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Where?

speaker: BILL
line: Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bill. What are you doing here?

speaker: BILL
line: I picked up the phone when you called Mom's. They said you could use a change of clothes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Um. Where's Mom?

speaker: BILL
line: I didn't tell Mom what happened. So, what did happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was... ahhh... knocked down a flight of stairs, but I'm okay, luckily.

speaker: BILL
line: You're not okay, Dana. I know about your cancer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told Mom not to tell you.

speaker: BILL
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because it's very personal... Because I don't want sympathy.

speaker: BILL
line: You think you can cure yourself. Mom tells me that you've gotten worse, that your cancer's gone into your bloodstream. What are you doing at work, gettin' knocked down, beaten up? What are you trying to prove? That you're gonna go out fighting?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, now come on, Bill...

speaker: BILL
line: Do you know what Mom's going through? Why do you think I didn't tell her when they called?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What should I be doing?!

speaker: BILL
line: We have a responsibility! Not just to ourselves, but to the people in our lives!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, look, just because I haven't bared my soul to you, or to Father McCue, or to God, it doesn't mean that I'm not responsible to what's important to me!

speaker: BILL
line: To what?! To who? This guy, Mulder? Well where is he, Dana? Where is he through all this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you for coming.

speaker: BILL
line: Dana...

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: We should be able to do a good enough examination of the body right here to remove any doubt.

speaker: MULDER
line: We won't know for sure until we do a carbon dating test.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: Well, I'm betting his physiology alone will be tell tale.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Piltdown Man Hoax wasn't uncovered for forty years until it failed the carbon dating test. And that wasn't even very good.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: If this were a hoax, there are 6 dead men up there on that mountain. There sure as hell is somebody else who believes it wasn't.

speaker: TECH
line: You well imagine it's a heavily traveled stairwell. We went back to the Bio Lab where we found an anomalous had latents. We found a partial match in the stairwell just four centimeters from one of yours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you run it through the NCIC?

speaker: TECH
line: Yep. This is your assailant, unfortunately he doesn't have a criminal record.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Try the federal data base.

speaker: TECH
line: I'll be damned! How did you know it would be a government employee?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where does he work?

speaker: TECH
line: Right here in Washington. Michael Kritschgau... formerly of the US Army... now attached to the Pentagon Research division in Virginia. Is this the man?

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: The body is 147 centimeters long. Weighing 24 kilograms deliquesced. Derma is hairless, grey with an elephantine texture. There are small eruptions on the surface of the skin most likely due to the presence of iron phosphate in the ice. Otherwise, there appears to be no scarring... no identifying marks... the circumference of the head is 64 centimeters. There are four digits on each hand. Three on each foot. Sex is... undeterminable. The eyes are black covered by what appears to be a thin membrane which I am now removing. The tissue underneath seems to be semi gelatinous with a fine network of veins through out. Examination of the chest cavity confirms the presence of what appears to be a cardio-pulmonary system... heart, lungs, all identifiable. Within a mass of white string like tissue that doesn't appear to correspond to human physiology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: STOP! FEDERAL AGENT! HOLD IT! MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU?! YOU ARE UNDER ARREST! Identify your location! GET OUT OF THE CAR! NOW! MOVE!

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Please don't shoot. I didn't mean to hurt you. I had no choice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put your hands on the car.

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: If you arrest me, they'll kill me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: The same people who are trying to kill you. The people who gave you your cancer.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: There's tissue culture to be done. DNA sequence and then analysis. And it would be wise to run a gas cromatograph and that carbon dated you suggested. But if this isn't alien, I don't know what it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I had reached agent Mulder at a warehouse just outside of Washington in Sethburg, Virginia. They had managed the frozen corpse by helicopter down the side of the mountain and across the Canadian border in a refrigerated truck. After conducting a limited physical examination Agent Mulder was ready to believe that the body was that of an extraterrestrial biological entity. That he had finally found the proof which had eluded him. Which would confirm not only the existence of alien life but of his sister Samantha's abduction.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: But this man Kritschgau had convinced you otherwise. How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He told me a story which detailed, point by point, the systematic way in which Agent Mulder had been deceived and used and how I as his partner I had been led down the same path. Losing a family member due to my allegiance and contracting a fatal disease which I was told was engineered by the men who responsible for Agent Mulder's deception.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Were you able to convince Agent Mulder of these facts?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was only able to convince him to meet me so that he might hear the story the way I had.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: What the hell is this?

speaker: ASSASSIN
line: Right there, Pork. How's the wound?

speaker: BABCOCK
line: I'll live.

speaker: ARLINSKY
line: What is this Babcock?

speaker: ASSASSIN
line: Get the door. Where did Mulder go?

speaker: BABCOCK
line: He got a call.

speaker: ASSASSIN
line: Is he a believer?

speaker: BABCOCK
line: Oh, yeah.

speaker: ASSASSIN
line: Then we're the only ones who know.

speaker: BABCOCK
line: Right. MULDER'S APARTMENT

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: The lie you believe, that they have cleverly led you to believe, Agent Mulder, is that there is intelligent life, other than our own, and that we have had contact with these life forms.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you're saying this has all been orchestrated? A hoax?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Which you've been used to perpetuate.

speaker: MULDER
line: You come by this knowledge how?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Working for the DOD Watching a military industrial complex that operated unbridled and unchecked during the Cold War, create a diversion of attention from itself and its continued misdeeds by confabulating enough believable evidence to convince passionate adepts like yourself... that it really could be true.

speaker: MULDER
line: And just by chance, you run into Agent Scully?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: I was just like you, Agent Mulder, suspicious of everything but what you should be. I ran the DOD's agitprop arm for a decade. I can show you records of disinformation dating back to the Korean War, before you were even born.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why come to me now? Why not four years ago?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: I have a son who's very sick. He served in the Gulf War... The lies are so deep the only way to cover them, is to create something even more incredible. They invented you. Your regression hypnosis, the story of your sister's abduction, the lies they fed your father. You wanted to believe so badly. And who could have blamed you?

speaker: MULDER
line: And the thousands of UFO sightings?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Above top secret military aircraft, concept designed to feed hysteria.

speaker: MULDER
line: Evidence of alien biology?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Unclassified, but naturally occurring biologic anomalies science will eventually explain.

speaker: MULDER
line: The body that was found?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Meticulously constructed out of biomaterials created through the hybridization of differentiated cells. What are called chimeras. Frozen into place over the course of a year using sentiment and materials that would bear out its age, poured through a small channel drilled in the rock above.

speaker: MULDER
line: They would have known that the body would be carbon dated, that it would be proved a fake.

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: The body will never be tested, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: You were only meant to see it, to make you believe the lie, so that you might finally commit and go public with the news.

speaker: MULDER
line: This man is a liar.

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: You can see for yourself, Agent Mulder. The body is already long gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Arlinsky's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So is this man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who did this, Mulder? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: What we had here was proof, Scully, there's no way it could be anything else.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said it yourself, Mulder. More tests needed to be run.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but, the ice core samples checked out. If the ice hasn't been tampered with, how could the body within be a fake?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cellular material found in the ice core samples were a direct match for what this man Kritschgau described. Hybrid cells, chimeras within the matrix.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do we know for sure that those cells are not extraterrestrial?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, everything this man described. You can't just guess at these details. I'm sorry, but the facts here completely overwhelm any argument against them!

speaker: MULDER
line: Facts overwhelmed by the lies created to support them!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the only lie here is the one that you continue to believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: After all I've seen and experienced, I refuse to believe that it's NOT true!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because it's easier to believe the lie. Isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell did that guy say to you, that you believe his story!?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He said that the men behind this hoax... behind these lies... gave me this disease to make you believe.

speaker: ASHLEY MONTAGUE
line: What we generally mean is, of course, intelligent life, something resembling our noble selves. It's entirely probable that there ARE such intelligent forms of life in other galaxies, in the universe. And it is even more probable that many of these forms are vastly more intelligent than we.

speaker: ANOTHER MAN ON VIDEO
line: I think there's no question but that we live in an inhabited universe, that has life all over it.

speaker: CARL SAGAN
line: By finding out what the other planets are like, by finding out whether there are civilizations on planets among the stars, we reestablish a meaningful context for ourselves.

speaker: ASHLEY MONTAGUE
line: I don't think we should wait until the encounter occurs, but that we should do all in our power to prepare ourselves for it.

speaker: ISSAC ASIMOV
line: I can conceive of no nightmare as terrifying as establishing such communication with a so-called superior or, if you wish, advanced technology in outer space.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Earlier this morning, I got a call from the police, asking me to come to Agent Mulder's apartment. The detective asked me... he needed me to identify a body...

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder died late last night from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head.
